['Anagrams are a form of word play where you rearrange the letters of a phrase or word to create another one, using all the original letters exactly once.', 'Amply spouted - \'Amply\' from "pale" (adding one more L), \'spouted\' from rearranging the remaining letters of \'peat\', \'moss\', and \'gps\'', 'Mop-star puppet - \'Mop\' can be derived from \'peat\' by removing \'t,\' \'star\' is a playful interpretation of the remaining letters in "human," and \'puppet\' rearranges the leftover letters including \'gs\', with an additional letter for artistic liberty since it\'s challenging to form two exact words without repeating or adding new characters.']
